summary:
Positive, engaging and tech-savvy in financing and marketing with knack for connecting the dots for culture as well as skill fit. 

Main characteristics: hands-on, pragmatic, persistent, committed, process improver, net-worker, team builder, understands the 'big picture' and strong reporting skills.

Developed further expertise as entrepreneur by direct involvement in commodity sectors especially in  spices market: its plantation and sustainability practices, and the whole supply chain mechanics, including all of its financing aspects.

Skilful and expertise banking/risk professional following more than 20 years in commercial banking and finance as well as private investment and financing professional with European and Asian exposures. Hands-on expertise and well built networks within the industries. Familiar user of Reuters Market Data System, Bloomberg terminals for Treasury and Risk Management, Bankscope. An advance user of MS Excel for financial modelling purpose.
Main professional and personal interests: technology / technological developments, business ethics/integrity, innovation, cyber-security, geo-politics, current affairs and travelling.

Specialties:
Sales and Marketing, Organic Spices, Brand Awareness, Banking and Finance, Fund raising, Management Consulting, General Management, Risk Management, Credit Risk, International Coordination, Business Development, Marketing Consulting, Supply Chain Management, Commodity Financing

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.description: Kutus Kutus is a herbal oil product derived from a diverse mixture of plants, roots, bark, and herbs. A traditional procedure helps in the preparation of the oil resulting in a product that promotes the healing process as it is safe and straightforward to apply to areas of pain
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
InterAromat BV is importer and distributor for finished food products as well as food ingredients in Europe, both for certified EU organic and conventional. InterAromat BV is a SKAL certified company. High end product such as organic tea: black tea, green tea,  white-tea silver needle or tisane tea: mint tea, jasmine tea, cinnamon tea or lemon-grass tea next to EU certified organic ingredients such as coconut sugar, cinnamon stick or cinnamon broken & clean. 
InterAromat is also importing and distributing product included noodle based products and corn based vermicelli for quick cooking and instant cooking. This is next to other carried products such as cashew and kemiri nuts.
As of recent InterAromat is also import and distribute fresh exotic fruits: mangosteen, dragon fruit, rambutan and salacca to selected countries in Europe (France and Spain) and flew them directly from the farming sources in Indonesia.
At the moment we carry and distribute branded end product such as: Bankitwangi, Rowadu, Iyes-Manohara, Finna, Exotico, Finna, Singabera, TPS Food: Mie Ayam 2 Telor, Gulas, etc., Kino. For further details please visit: www.interaromat.com 

For the principal partners InterAromat BV also carry sales and marketing advisory and representative of selected FMCG in food and beverages industry. At the moment InterAromat BV is quite loaded by carrying principals of food and beverage products from Indonesia and/or Asia.
profile_positions.title: Founder / CEO

profile_positions.description: Importer and distributor of high quality and certified medical supplies with main focus on vascular surgery equipments. InterMedika is a registered vendor and own necessary licenses to operate as one in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Managing Partner

company.name: BUKIT SARI ORGANIC TEA PLANTATION - Europe Representative

profile_positions.company: BUKIT SARI ORGANIC TEA PLANTATION - Europe Representative
profile_positions.description: Bukit Sari Estate is the biggest organic tea plantation in Indonesia with total area around 3,500 hectares (8,600 acres), each of plantations is unique with its climate and geographical situation, grew each unique minerals and nutrients in the crops and also lifting the invaluable farm biodiversity. It is situated > 1,000m above sea level and surrounded by natural conservation areas, enriched by many companion of woods, aromatic and herbal plants, unique reptile and insects. The organic certification is issued by Control Union based on standard of USDA-NOP, Japan Agriculture Standard (JAS) and Organic EU.
profile_positions.title: Sales Representative

profile_positions.description:
Lead strategic and funding development of Unispices BV in order to expand and win its market share.  Successfully established company’s recognition within selected spices industry within 1-year period through committed branding strategy. Among the effort: Unispices B.V. becomes one of the first 4 founders of Sustainable Spices Initiatives (www.sustainablespicesinitiative.com), next to Intertaste, Verstegen and Euroma. It is a newly generic sustainability standard for spices sector developed in cooperation with companies, government agencies and social organization. Current partners include Griffith Laboratories USA, Cassia Coop, ITC Limited, Jayanti, McCormick, NedSpice, Olam, Sabater, Symrise, Unilever, Both Ends, Cordaid, ICCO, Rainforrest Alliance, Royal Tropical Institute and World Spice Organization.

Successfully attracted private investors and raised fund for the group’s operational and developed broader knowledge in supply chain industry, including its strict compliance in food related operations.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Managing Director

profile_positions.company: MNC GROUP - PT MNC ASIA HOLDING TBK
profile_positions.description:
Stewarded and advised the group’s Treasury bond issuance in Europe (Aerospace Holding & BV) in conjunction with Deutsch Bank Nederland.
MNC is the largest television network in Indonesia providing 24-hour international cable channel for news and general entertainment
profile_positions.title: Chief Representative

profile_positions.description:
Reported to Stibbe's (the appointed Trustee by District Court of Amsterdam), A. van Hees and H.P. de Haan RA and provided expert opinion on corporate portfolio in the range of USD 600 millions consisting of syndicated loans and treasury bonds

Analyzed portfolio performance, prepared recommendation and negotiated on behalf of the Trustees with creditors’ Steering Committee. Actively and widely used Reuters Market Data System and Bloomberg terminal for Treasury and Risk Management, Syndicated Loans and Portfolio Risk Analytic.
Expand skills on debt recoveries management and broaden relationship with players of global debt restructuring and debt recovery team of reputable banks.
profile_positions.title: Portfolio Manager

company.name: Indover bank, N.V. (wholly owned by central bank of Indonesia)

profile_positions.description:
Managed a profitable FI loan portfolio worth about EUR 250 million (one third of the bank’s Total Assets) covering areas of Europe, selected CIS countries (Russia, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Azerbaijan) and selected Asian countries (Indonesia, Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, China). Responsibilities included coordinating the management, assessment, recommendation and implementation of bank limits (credit-, money market-, and foreign exchange line, etc.)  Supervising the FI assets buildup through syndicated and bilateral lending and trade financing. Managing the bank's fund raising activities by way of syndicated and bilateral lending as well as bonds issuance.
Supervised a global team of 5 account-managers located in 3 different countries (Amsterdam Head Office, Hamburg Branch Office and Jakarta Representative Office) with one collective profit target.
Actively used namely Reuters Market Data System, Bloomberg terminals, Bankscope, etc. in supporting the commercial activities.
Developed a well-established and first class networking of bank, non-banking financial institution and corporate client base in Europe, Asia and Middle East.

Successfully achieved various funding sources which summing up to EUR 600 million since 2005, through syndicated loans, bilateral loans and interbank money market. This was necessary to finance the group’s assets expansion. Developed excellent relationship with internationally based bank funder and global lead arrangers and underwriters.
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Financial Institutions Department Head

profile_positions.description:
Reported to Group Risk Manager. Provided regular reports and advises to Group Risk Committee (GRC) and Assets and Liabilities Committee (ALCO) respectively on the progressing of the implemented risk policies and corporate governance next to market-, credit- and liquidity risk. Contributed the development of the bank’s General Risk Principle, which was used as the main risk governance. 
Responsibilities included managing- and assessing trading limits, management of capital usage and assessment of risk strategies. Provided risk management related reports to De Nederlandse Bank (Dutch Central Bank) in collaboration with Accounting and Reporting Department.
Used KVAR (Kondor Value at Risk) system and Reuters Kondor+, trade and risk management solution tools, to monitor and manage risk at the trading floor. Actively used Bloomberg terminals and Reuters Market Data System.

Designed, developed and implemented communication plan on risk awareness program with regards to Basel requirements and overseeing its development and implementation throughout the  matrix organization and carried out review on its effectiveness.
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Risk Manager

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam, Hamburg, Hongkong, Singapore and Jakarta
profile_positions.description:
Reported to President Director. Setup newly established IC&SS Department. Coordinated marketing and sale support activities. Responsibilities included planning, developing and implementing the bank's marketing strategies, marketing communications and public relation activities. Oversees development and implementation of support materials and services for commercial units in the area of marketing and communications. Monitored and directed the efforts of cross selling and coordinated at the strategic and tactical levels with the other function of the bank organization.
Supervised 6 supporting marketing and communication staff worldwide (Amsterdam Head Office, Hamburg Branch Office, Hong Kong Subsidiary, Singapore Liaison Office and Jakarta Representative Office)
Developed further skill on coordination and remote management in a matrix organization while sharpened the implementation skill in the organization's turnaround project.
profile_positions.title: Vice President, International Coordination & Sales Support Department Head

company.name: Indover bank, N.V. (wholly owned by central bank of Indonesia)

profile_positions.description:
Setup the department from scratch. A corporate banking activity mainly on acquiring assets and building portfolio on (syndicated) lending, fixed income and other marketable securities. Actively co-managed the department’s portfolio consisting of loans and marketable securities worth in the range of USD 1 billion that contributed about a third of the bank’s profit. Successfully brought the bank’s team from general bank lender into an active role as mandated lead arrangers and underwriters. Regular user of Bloomberg and Reuters financial information system.

Built excellent clientele base resulting from both first class originations and well-developed placement capacity.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager Syndications Department - Corporate Banking

profile_positions.description:
Analyzed and processed credit and investment applications, and prepared recommendation for Financial Institutions- (FI) and Treasury portfolio.
Provided regular (credit-, market- and liquidity) risk assessment in the region of Asia, Middle East and West Europe.
profile_positions.title: Credit and Investment Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description:
SAIL Amsterdam is the largest public event in the Netherlands. Its inaugural edition took place in 1975 as part of celebrations marking Amsterdam's 700th jubilee.
The event proved such a great success that a second edition was planned in 1980. In order to deliver solid direction, the Sail Amsterdam Foundation was established in 1977. Ever since, SAIL Amsterdam has returned to Amsterdam's waterways every five years to showcase the city's maritime legacy.
